sa740:1.2: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.
sa740:2.2: “Suppose a monk cultivates the seven factors of awakening.
sa740:2.3: After often cultivating them, he’ll attain seven fruits.
sa740:2.5: This refers to nirvāṇa with remainder when he attains knowledge in the present life and [nirvāṇa] at his life’s end when he doesn’t attain knowledge in the present life.
sa740:2.6: If that isn’t the case, he’ll end the five lower bonds and attain parinirvāṇa in the interim.
sa740:2.7: If that’s not the case, then he’ll attain parinirvāṇa at birth.
sa740:2.8: If that’s not the case, he’ll attain parinirvāṇa without practice.
sa740:2.9: If that’s not the case, he’ll attain parinirvāṇa with practice.
sa740:2.10: If that’s not the case, he’ll attain parinirvāṇa upstream.”
sa740:3.1: After the Buddha taught this sutra, the monks who heard what he taught rejoiced and handed it down.
